title: Tinsley Mortimer shares that dreams 'really do come true' as she confirms romance with Scott Kluth
text:
Their whirlwind romance is enough of a storyline for any reality show.

And it seems as though Tinsley Mortimer's relationship with Scott Kluth is back on again as she shared a dreamy photo taken by her beau to Instagram on Tuesday morning.

The 44-year-old socialite was all smiles as she posed in her hotel room at The Langham while overlooking the Chicago River with Scott standing behind the camera to capture the moment.

Love is in the air: Tinsley Mortimer's relationship with Scott Kluth is back on again as she shared a dreamy photo taken by her beau to Instagram on Tuesday morning

Tinsley was dressed for the brisk autumn weather wearing a beige cableknit sweater with jeans.

She added just a bit of bling to her casual ensemble with a host of chunky gold bracelets and a thick watch.

'Somewhere over the rainbow skies are blue, And the dreams that you dare to dream really do come true,' she wrote before including a rainbow and camera emoji with 'by Scott' at the end.

Picture perfect: Tinsley and Scott's relationship has weathered a few storms throughout the years as they've broken up and gotten back together multiple times; seen on Instagram

Tinsley and Scott's relationship has weathered a few storms throughout the years as they've broken up and gotten back together multiple times.

They were first introduced by Tinsley's Real Housewives of New York co-star Carole Radziwill.

On their first (blind) date, which was filmed for the Bravo program, Scott and Tinsley ended up making out in front of their friends.

Just a few months later, their relationship seemed to have run its course as it was growing increasingly difficult for the couple to spend time together while living in different cities.

'We've had our ups and downs, and we've broken up a couple times,' she told the Daily Dish in 2018. 'It's been tough. You know, distance is hard. We love each other. It's so cliché and cheesy, but it's true'

'We've had our ups and downs, and we've broken up a couple times,' she told the Daily Dish in 2018. 'It's been tough. You know, distance is hard. We love each other. It's so cliché and cheesy, but it's true.

'I just really, honestly want to just make it work with him and then if babies come, marriage comes, and all that stuff, that would be great, an extra bonus on top of everything.'

She joined the New York cast in 2017 and has remained a main castmember, with the 11th season ending earlier this summer.

Tinsley's ex-husband, Standard Oil heir Topper Mortimer, wed shoe designer Tabitha Simmons during a star-studded ceremony in Manhattan on June 11, 2018.
